alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor; Lewis; Mason; Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 03 at 2:55PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY FOR PARTS OF SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON... Lower elevation river basins in southwest Washington could see flooding as early as Tuesday night with chances stretching through Sunday morning. Several bouts of precipitation will come through the area during that time. There are many factors going into the chance for flooding. * Low elevation snow over the area * low snow levels at the start of the the period, but a significant rise in snow level during the first precipitation wave * timing of warming compared to timing of the heaviest precipitation; if the warmth doesn`t show up until after most of the precip has occurred, the rivers are more likely to stay below flood stage. * how much lowland snow will still be on the ground and how much will melt during the precip, with the potential for adding lowland snowmelt to the storm runoff. There is a potential for minor to moderate flooding is possible on rivers such as the Skokomish, Newaukum, Chehalis, and Skookumchuck, depending on the above factors. Or no flooding at all. A Flood Potential Outlook means there is around a 30% to 50% chance of flooding. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service for additional information.
